page.title: 01The local area Plym.St.Mary.
page.content: The area is full of{farms,}some of which date back to the original Domesday Book.Cattle are mainly reared although there is some crop growth. The{A.38}runs through the middle taking commuters and lorries to Plymouth.A{railway line}runs across the northern edge with a 125 diesel express taking just under 4hrs to reach London. { Tourism}is noticeable with a few scattered caravans and a"Little Chef" restaurant catering for travellers along the A.38 { Houses}are creeping into the area from the west and a new{Industrial {Estate}is just starting being built. These are gradually eroding the natural beauty of Plympton. A small industry for{quarrying}gravel for roads is at the eastern end.
